pros:
I feel SVHC values their staff and employees and makes attempts to show this
throughout the year.
cons: Per-diem pay is not as competitive as other places.
Limited specialties which makes it difficult to treat patients.

job_title: RN Case Manager in Bennington, VT
pros: Friendly work environment, small community hospital
cons: Older building, but undergoing several upgrades

pros: Years of experience, lots of learning opportunities
Coworkers are like family and easy to work with.
The staff are an absolutely amazing staff to work with.

job_title: Medical Practice Manager in Metairie, LA
cons: Not a lot of opportunities for education and career advancement

pros: Good teams, great care patients, flexible schedules, hometown feel.
cons: Great specialists, just need more specialists

review_title: "DO MORE WITH LESS" motto says it all.
pros:
1 - good pay for the area
2 - free meal a few times a year
3 - some really great hard-working people
4 - most of the time was able to get time off requests
5 - a few good eggs that really cared about you and the patients 
6 - good benefit package
cons:
1 - the workload was too great for 1 person. Very frustrating when you ask for help, get a pat on the back and help fir a day, but the issues remain the same. Problems are ignored.
2 - manager not available most of the time
3 - clicks and favoritism, reminding me of 3rd grade playground antics.
4 - problems within the department are rarely addressed and when they are, it is your fault for letting it get that bad.
5 - often times political preferences were shared openly in a pressuring way.
6 - snide remarks about gay people when they weren't around.
7 - they said we were a team, but we were not. Every man for themself.
8 - holiday spirit went out the window when parties were cancelled due to lack of interest.
9 - cold clinical envirinment

pros: Award-winning health care provider whose leadership is proactive in taking steps to navigate changes in health care in order to ensure continued success.
cons: As margins become thinner, more and more open positions are going unfilled and existing employees are expected to take up the slack.  In  my opinion, many many employees are overworked and quality is suffering (non-clinical areas - no opinion or experience with clinical working conditions).

review_title: Like at many hospitals currently, due to necessary cost cuts, your job is always on the line.
pros: Hospital known for its great nursing, friendly staff.
cons: Cost cuts including labor, constant worry if you will lose your job.   is in many companies, there tend to be employee "cliques".

review_title: Over all a good place to work but disorganized.
pros: Great patients, providers were great to work with, vacation time was generous.
cons: Pay was not that great. I took a job with another hospital that paid much more for the same job. Also, we basically had no manager. She was absent most of the time and had no idea what was going on in the office. Also, the system for patient check in is a time waster.

pros: Lab works as a unit, where everybody's strengths are amplified and weaknesses are accommodated and addressed. Work load is just right .
cons: Training can be a bit disorganized

pros: Never a dull moment. Constantly learning and juggling multiple number one priority
cons: Can be to much of you let it

pros: friendly staff, the work load is not overwhelming
